greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Xor-Moebius transform of A324819, where A324819(n) = bitor(2*A156552(n), A323243(n)), where bitor is A003986.
comment: It seems that the records, which are A000225(1+n) = 2^(1+n) - 1 occur at primes, as occur also the records for the width of terms, A000523(a(n)), and the records for the binary weight of terms, A000120(a(n)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 (based on Hans Havermann's factorization of A156552)
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
Index entries for sequences related to sigma(n)
program: A156552(n) = {my(f = factor(n), p2 = 1, res = 0); for(i = 1, #f~, p = 1 << (primepi(f[i, 1]) - 1); res += (p * p2 * (2^(f[i, 2]) - 1)); p2 <<= f[i, 2]); res}; \\ From A156552 by _David A. Corneth_
A324819(n) = bitor(2*A156552(n),A323243(n)); \\ Needs code also from A323243.
A324821(n) = { my(v=0); fordiv(n, d, if(issquarefree(n/d), v=bitxor(v, A324819(d)))); (v); };
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 18 2019
